metadata.title: CVE-2019-16995 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.0.3, a memory leak exits in hsr_dev_finalize()in net/hsr/hsr_device.c if hsr_add_port fails to add a port, which maycause denial of service, aka CID-6caabe7f197d.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16995` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-148-generic - 4.4.0-148.174~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-148-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-148.174~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-148-lowlatency - 4.4.0-148.174~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-148-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-148.174~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-148-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-148.174~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-148-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-148.174~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-148-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-148.174~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-148-generic - 4.4.0-148.174~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-148-lowlatency - 4.4.0-148.174~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1044-aws - 4.4.0-1044.47
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1059-azure - 4.15.0-1059.64~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-148.174~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1044.47').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1059.64~14.04.1').
